index.title: реактивный фронтэнд инженер
about.part1:
Дорогой гость,
Рада встрече! Привет из Оакланда, Бэй Ареа!
about.part2: Did I promise to tell about myself if you visit my web page? Let’s get started!
about.part3: The story of my relationships with web technologies begins in the distant 1999. When I created my first HTML-page about cats for programming class in the middle school. That page was awesome. I got a five for diligence and left to grow up. In 2008 we met again. But this time it was a serious long-term partnership.
about.part4: Since that time I've seen a lot. Battle of table and div layouts. I fought for divs. Carefully glued image sprites to create rounded borders. Yes, I was dreaming about border-radius for so long. I saw the dawn and sunset of jQuery. I remember how all script tags were moved from the head to the end of body all around the web. Bragged to server developers with my application on Express.
about.part5: In mid-2012, I was bored, so I plunged into the world of server Java development. After six months of debugging errors in the console, I decided to test the Sass, Backbone, and Grunt. After that, I could not find the strength to come back.
about.part6: The further, the better. Single page application conquered the world. I couldn't resist the beauty of React's virtual DOM neither did the rest of the tech world.
about.part7: Todays I would love to continue solving real-life problems,  explore new technologies and concepts,  make my brain burn while working on complex features. And find a dream team to reach new heights together!

rg.title: Portfolio 2017

rg.1: Implemented internationalization with react-intl for English and Russian speakers. With browser language auto detect
rg.2: Continuous deployment with generous Netlify service
rg.3: All images are stored in Cloudinary CDN for fast and reliable delivery
rg.4: Favicon set is stored on Firebase CDN (since I am using them in multiple personal projects)
rg.5: Webpack: separate sets for development & production (webpack merge)
rg.6: Responsive components (on init and on resize)
rg.7: Flexbox for layout instead of grid libraries
rg.8: px free styles. Only relative units: rem & vw, vh
rg.9: Local component styles with CSS modules
fr8_shipper_flow.title: FR8Star Instant Rate
fr8_shipper_flow.about: Request for quote flow for shippers - an instant freight rate based on live market data including all permits and third-party costs. This flow is an entry point for shippers.
fr8_shipper_flow.1: Multiple entry points: rate calculator widget, equipment dealers sites (partners) and email campaigns
fr8_shipper_flow.2: Each screen can work independently, has a URL and is accessible directly from the address bar. The same flow is used for edit mode.
fr8_shipper_flow.3: Map interactions: custom routes, select pickup/dropoff both from the map and address autocomplete component
fr8_shipper_flow.4: Different layouts for each shipment type on screen 2
fr8_shipper_flow.5: Custom warnings for oversized (superloads), international shipping
fr8_shipper_flow.6: Custom rate cards for partial loads, instantly bookable loads and loads with discount
fr8_shipper_flow.7: Smart navigation system: based on rfq params UI dispatcher redirects users to a specific screen
load_scanner.title: FR8Star Freight Finder
load_scanner.about: FR8Star’s freight finder, also known as a Load Scanner, is a comprehensive tool empowering smaller trucking companies to help them find available truck loads for their fleet.
load_scanner.1: Section-based layout. Each section works independently. User can add and delete cards
load_scanner.2: Developed frequent lanes and availabilities components. Reused them later in registration for carriers flow
load_scanner.3: Notification switcher triggers an update of load matching top section
load_scanner.4: Smart recalculation of slider component's visibility based on screen width and number of active cards
load_scanner.5: Custom page state with pre-opened modals based on special query params
